Case reference: 2012020064.CaseDesc: On June 24, 2000, Irma Murdock was seen for the last time in Winnipeg, Manitoba. It is believed that Irma may have travelled to Vancouver, British Colombia.

Case reference: 2014002472.CaseDesc: In April 1988, Stacey Rogers was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Taylor, British Columbia. Stacey had stated that she was planning on travelling to Edmonton, Alberta, but did not go to Edmonton. It is possible that she went to Grande Prairie, Alberta.

Case reference: 2018041450.CaseDesc: On July 19, 1999, Fakhri Daoud was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Fakhri had returned to his residence to gather some money, his passport, and some of his personal belongings. The day before, he had purchased a one-way flight ticket to Aman, Jordan.

Case reference: 2016061097.CaseDesc:
On June 18, 1979, the body of an unidentified male was found in the Detroit River near Riverside Drive and Crawford Avenue in the city of Windsor, Ontario. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 145lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. 
He is believed to have been in the water for 1 week to six months.

Hair: Black, Curly, Short, Moustache, possibly `Lamb Chop`style sideburns
Teeth: Unerupted wisdom teeth, which may have been impacted.

Case reference: 2020021899.CaseDesc: Nowell HALFE was last seen by family in Edmonton, Alberta in 2013. The last documented occurrence for HALFE puts him in Edmonton, Alberta in January of 2014.

Case reference: 2014002350.CaseDesc: On May 29th, 1990 Pierre Beaudoin left his residence in Hebron, Prince Edward Island. Police later confirmed that Mr. Beaudoin stayed at the Hotel Francis in New Richmond, Quebec and was seen for the last time on May 31, 1990, when he checked out of the hotel. Pierre’s truck and personal belongings were found in a dense, wooded area approximately 45 miles southeast of Route 275 in Balmoral, New Brunswick on August 17th, 1990.

Case reference: 2006021899.CaseDesc: De Qian Rang was last seen on April 20, 1992 in the Village of Elora, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance De Qian and her husband operated the 'Abacus Restaurant', south of Elora. An extensive police investigation has failed to locate Mrs. Rang.  Police suspect foul play in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2013000126.CaseDesc: In December 2007, Bonnie Marie Joseph was reported missing to the Fort St-James RCMP.  Further investigation determined that Miss Joseph was last seen on September 8, 2007 in Vanderhoof, BC.  She led a high risk lifestyle and was known to hitchhike alone between Fort St-James, Vanderhoof and Prince George, BC.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, heart with Mom & Djily

Case reference: 2014004448.CaseDesc: Carmelo Tomasino was last seen on January 19, 2004 in Montreal. His absence and not calling home is out of character.

Tattoo: Chest, Hearts with the names Amanda and Brenda

Case reference: 2019054192.CaseDesc: Danick Bourgeois was seen for the last time during the month of July 2019. He has been known to reside in a homemade trailer in St. Bernadin, Ontario and in a tent near Hawkesbury, Ontario.

Case reference: 2008016399.CaseDesc: Nikki Lysanewitch has been missing since July 1994.  He was last seen leaving his residence near Bobcaygeon, Ontario.  His pick-up truck was later found parked at the Toronto International Airport.

Case reference: 2006004699.CaseDesc: On 13 July 1992, William Aman left the shore of Lake Ontario to go fishing.  His boat was later found with his ball cap 3.2 kilometers off of Pete's Point, Lake Ontario. Mr. Aman has not been located and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2013000018.CaseDesc: On November 17th, 2010, Varaporn Toassami left Canada with her daughter, Chonticha Galamae Ellefson-Toassami in contravention of a family Court Order.  They travelled to Thailand, where it is believed they still are today.  Varaporn Toassami has been charged with child abduction under Section 282 of the Criminal Code.  There is a warrant for her arrest.

Case reference: 2012020005.CaseDesc: David Cox was last seen on April 8, 2011 in the Cranbrook, BC area.  He was known to be living a high risk lifestyle. His disappearance is considered suspicious in nature and foul play has not been ruled out.

Case reference: 2014002701.CaseDesc: On November 25, 1986, Carol Bigtobacco was reported missing to the RCMP. She was 8 years old when she was last seen 3 years earlier on March 19, 1983. It is believed she had wandered off from the family residence on Siksika Nation. She may have suffered from a disability.

Boots: One boot was found, unknown colour

Case reference: 2021016411.CaseDesc: On June 25, 1979, Lorraine Legault was seen for the last time as she played in front of the home of her grandparents in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2018054180.CaseDesc: On May 8, 1992, John Leonard was seen for the last time when he borrowed a friend's vehicle.  Later that same day, the vehicle was recovered at Woodbine Racetrack in Toronto.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Pair of dice

Case reference: 2014006178.CaseDesc: An investigation revealed that nobody had seen or heard from Alex Klym since the mid 1970's. The family had made attempts to locate Alex, but they were unsuccessful and nobody ever reported that he was missing. Inquiries were made with various government agencies in an attempt to find some evidence of him after the mid 1970's. There is no trace of him. The body of Alex Klym has never been recovered. It is not known what happened to Alex, but foul play cannot be ruled out.

Case reference: 2014006175.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, at approximately 5:30 a.m., Jason Bathily and his twin sister, Clarene Bathily, were seen for the last time with their mother, Adelyne Mounga, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001059.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1970, the body of a heavyset young adult male with black hair was found on the shore of Kamloops Lake in British Columbia. He had all his teeth removed during his life and had no noticeable scars or tattoos. He is believed to have drowned in the Thompson River near Riverside Park a few days earlier.

Shirt: Blue, Yellow, Corsair brand, checkered pattern
Blue, Longsleeve, Lancer Brand, Size Large, Blue with purple and black check pattern, longsleeve
White, Bluestone brand, long sleeves, size medium
Jacket: Nylon, Light Blue, Squall brand with hood, golfer label on front with zipper
Shoes: Brown, Oxfords, Vibram brand, made in Italy, with shoe laces

Case reference: 2008021099.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1966, Diane Prevost was seen for the last time as she was camping at Grundy Provincial Park in Britt, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Diane had been playing on the beach, and had told her father that she wanted to go back to the campsite. When her father turned to do so, she was gone.

Shirt: Blue, Red, checked top with red at cuffs and collar

Case reference: 2014004849.CaseDesc: In the evening of November 21, 2006, Yves Castonguay left his residence in Bécancour, Gentilly sector. He may have been spotted a few times; however Mr. Castonguay has had no contact with his family since this date. His family have reason to fear for his health and safety.

Case reference: 2018041855.CaseDesc: On December 8, 1992, Grayce Baxter was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. She was a known transgendered sex trade worker. She had a transaction with Patrick Johnson who subsequently confessed to her homicide. Grayce’s remains were never recovered.

Coat: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Fur, Full length coat

Case reference: 2006010199.CaseDesc: Mr. Donald Chorney was last seen leaving the Keys Lake Campground near Grassy Narrows, Ontario to go for a boat ride.  He has never returned and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2006025899.CaseDesc: Robin Windross has not been seen since November 1977. He has an intellectual age of about 6 years old, speaks with a strong speech impediment and is difficult to understand. He may have left Huronia Regional Centre because he was concerned about being transferred in the facility to a unit with mostly adults. He had always been housed with children.

Case reference: 2014004844.CaseDesc: On September 30, 2006, Aaron Derbyshire, was seen for the last time in the early morning hours in downtown Kelowna, British Columbia.  Aaron, a long term resident of Kelowna, had spent the evening out with friends after a day's work as a local surveyor.

Case reference: 2014002334.CaseDesc: Gary Percival was reported missing in Regina, SK on April 9, 1973. A witness did state that Gary Percival may have been a patient in a hospital in New York State in 1974. Mr. Percival has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006012199.CaseDesc: Leonel Phillips left Butterfield Lodge by boat to travel on Lake Matinenda (Blind River, Ontario) to Log Chateau. Mr. Phillips' boat was located adrift but he was never found. He is presumed to have drowned.

Scar: Chest, A burn scar below his right breast

Case reference: 2014004403.CaseDesc: Ramona Shular was last seen in Fort St John, British Columbia at the end of November 2003.

Tattoo: Right Ankle, Red heart and rose
Mark: Mole in front of left ear
Scar: Right Eye, Scar from right eyebrow to cheek bone

Case reference: 2016065831.CaseDesc: On October 12, 1977, the remains of a male, believed to be an adult, were found in the water off of Coney Island, Lake of the Woods, Kenora. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 200lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was fully clothed, however, no description of clothing is available.  It is believed that he had been in the water for several weeks.

Case reference: 2005005799.CaseDesc: October 8, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found floating in Hamilton Bay near the Skyway Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 140-150 lbs and his length was measured at 5'4"-5'6", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is thought to have been in the water for months to years.

Teeth: His upper right central incisor has a silicate/resin restoration.

Case reference: 2010000299.CaseDesc: On September 3, 2009, Douglas Chong, 62 years of age, called his sister and advised he had attended the Toronto Western Hospital as he had not been feeling well. He advised he had been dehydrated and was sent to Seaton House to recover where he had been for three days and was feeling better. This was the last time anyone has heard from Douglas Chong. He has not retuned to his last known address. Neither Toronto Western Hospital nor Seaton House have any record of Mr. Chong having been there on or about the 3rd of September, 2009. There has been no use of his health or bank cards since September 3, 2009.

Case reference: 2009004999.CaseDesc: At the time of her disappearance, Dawn Carisse was a patient of the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital. She is generally very pleasant though suffers from short term memory loss due to cardiac arrest several years earlier.  Dawn Carisse always spoke of leaving the hospital and going to where she believed her family would be. Her family was in the Kirkland Lake area and then moved to Sudbury. She was aware of both, and her possible destinations were Kirkland Lake or Sudbury. She was last seen on Highway 11 North, in North Bay, Ontario.

Hair: Brown, Curly, Parted in centre, short bangs

Luggage: May have had a dark duffle bag in her possession.
Dress: Maroon, Pink, Long dress with faint white flowers, short sleeves and front buttons.

Case reference: 2014003406.CaseDesc: Anthony Janvier was last seen at the courthouse in Cold Lake, Alberta on April 8, 1998. He was reported missing by his mother on February 7, 2002. Anthony lived a transient lifestyle which accounts for the 4 year delay in reporting him missing.

Case reference: 2014003281.CaseDesc: On November 14, 1971, at around 6:30 am, Eileen “Gail” McCarthy was last seen leaving her home in Edmonton, Alberta to go to work at the Misericordia Hospital. Eileen worked as a nurse and did not arrive at work that day. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Brown, White, Brown Coat with White Fur Collar

Case reference: 2010000899.CaseDesc: Wilfred Bruder was last spoken to on February 28th, 2004 while talking on a pay phone at the Willow West Mall in Guelph. This mall is adjacent to the Hanlon Expressway (Hwy 6) that runs north/south through the west end of Guelph. He was depressed and said his goodbyes to his ex-wife and children.  He had a history of depression and alcholism and was drinking heavily at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2006028199.CaseDesc: Barbara Sadowski and her husband lived a reclusive lifestyle on Marten Lake, in the Marten River area. She was last seen on the 23 or 24 of June 2006, walking along the beach near her home on Marten Lake.  She was recently in poor health.  She walked at a very slow pace, often using one or two canes or walking sticks.

Hair: Grey, White, Long, Often one or two braids
Teeth: Visible Missing, Poor condition, no teeth, mouth appears sunken

Glasses: Brown, Large frame, older style, thick lenses

Case reference: 2016059266.CaseDesc:
On March 29th, 2008, the body of a male was found under a subway bridge at Bloor and Parliament Streets, Toronto, where he apparently slept often. A beige jacket, black nylon pants, a dark blue knit hat and tan ankle shoes with tan laces were located in close proximity to his body.  He was uncircumcised and his appendix is absent.
He is believed to be a homeless individual and was found by another homeless man who referred to him as "Pops" and "Joe".

Hair: Brown, Grey, Wavy, Short, Beard & moustache, slightly greying & yellow
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost prior to his death and the remaining teeth are decayed. There is no dental work.

Underwear: Dark Blue, White, Dark blue/black and white striped boxers
Pants: Checkered black and blue flannel pants

Deformity: Valgus deformity of both large toes
Fractured/Broken Bones: Pelvis, Healed fracture, left Ilio-pubic ramus
Scar: 1.5 cm in length, inner right knee
Right Abdomen, 16 cm scar with suture marks
a 6 cm scar on his right lower abdomen

Case reference: 2005069040.CaseDesc: Yaseen is believed to be with his mother, Marina Zlonikova. They may be in the Ukraine.

Case reference: 2012020087.CaseDesc: James Carlson was last seen between 7:00 p.m. and 8:00 p.m. at a local business in Watrous, SK. On May 5, 2010, Mr. Carlson's 1985 Chevrolet Monte Carlo was found in a rural area south of Rosthern. Police have not located Mr. Carlson.

Hair: Brown, Balding in front , longer in back

Case reference: 2006008199.CaseDesc: Harley Metherel telephoned home from Vancouver on December 24, 1980, requesting a money transfer. Money was sent to him, but he never picked it up, and he has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002270.CaseDesc: On 2 July, 1992, Behnam Amjadi was seen for the last time when he left his residence in the Côtes-des-Neiges et Notre-Dame-de-Grace district in Montreal, Quebec. Behnam has not been seen and has not contacted his ex-spouse or his brothers in Iran since.

Case reference: 2014004308.CaseDesc: Joseph Laboucan was last seen in Peace River, Alberta, on or around August 10, 1988. He lived on the streets in Peace River and Little Buffalo, Alberta. He made occasional trips around the area as far as Edmonton.

Case reference: 2014002240.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1993, Marcus Laing was reported missing when he failed to show up for work which was out of character for him.

Case reference: 2020010478.CaseDesc: On January 30, 1970, at approximately 3:30pm, Lois Perret was last seen by her boyfriend at her place of work in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Lois had quit her job and moved out of her apartment. During the time of her disappearance, Lois was three months pregnant and drove a 1964 black Valiant convertible.

Case reference: 2014000005.CaseDesc: Kenneth Chester FEHR was last seen on November 27th, 2012 at approximately 5:30 PM in the 1700 block of Idylwyld Drive North, Saskatoon, SK. He left behind his wallet and cell phone. Prior to leaving he told numerous family and friends good bye. He also spoke of harming himself.

Hair: Blonde, Wavy, Dirty blonde wavy hair down past his shoulders

Pants: Cotton, Grey, Sweat pants. Work clothes stained with tar
Shirt: Cotton, Black, Work clothes stained with tar.  Could be grey in colour

Case reference: 2014001441.CaseDesc: On April 28, 1972, James Cordell was seen for the last time leaving his parents’ residence in St. Catharines, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, James was driving a 1970 silver blue Dodge Polar vehicle.  He had a cast on his right arm and his teeth were wired shut as a result of a motor vehicle collision.

Shirt: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, White, SHRT SLEEV, Mauve and white terrycloth short sleeve

Case reference: 2016058794.CaseDesc: Raymond Raine was reported missing in 2016 after family members had not heard from him in several years. Raymond has ties to Maskwacis, Alberta, but was last known to be in the Fort Saskatchewan, Alberta area.

Case reference: 2019026482.CaseDesc: Kristofer Couture drove his vehicle from Alberta to the lower mainland in British Columbia to find work and had cut off ties from his family. Kristofer worked construction for a short period of time while living in his vehicle near Maple Ridge, British Columbia. Kristofer also frequented a gym in Burnaby, British Columbia. Kristofer was last seen leaving the Royal Columbian Hospital in New Westminster, British Columbia on January 26, 2019. His unoccupied vehicle was seen the following day parked at the Elk Mountain Trail in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Kristofer was reported missing on May 17, 2019 and his vehicle was found parked at the same location.

Case reference: 2014005452.CaseDesc: Mr. Hopkins departed his cabin on Sunday, November 2, 1975, to go fishing on Lake Athapapuskow. When he failed to return three days later he was reported missing to police by a friend. Soon thereafter, on November 6th, Mr. Hopkins' boat was located overturned banging against rocks. Numerous personal items were found on shore around the boat. Despite intensive boat patrols and dragging operations, Mr. Hopkins has not been found. Foul play is not suspected, and it is assumed that Mr. Hopkins drowned.

Case reference: 2014011272.CaseDesc: During the morning of June 10, 2014, Yvonne Wallace left her residence. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003404.CaseDesc: Armand Comtois was reported missing on May 2, 1985. At the time of his disappearance he was living in Saint-Hyacinthe, Quebec. He was seen by a family member on March 9, 1985 but he has not been seen or heard from since this date. He also used the name of "Simon".

Teeth: Dental appliance, partial composed of 4 upper teeth.

Case reference: 2014001384.CaseDesc: On March 12, 1974, Gilles Larose was seen for the last time in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2022006239.CaseDesc: On December 4, 1990, at approximately 10:00 a.m., Vincent Stack was seen for the last time by his family members leaving his residence in Buffalo, New York. Vincent’s vehicle was located abandon in a parking lot near Niagara Falls State Park in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of his disappearance, Vincent was despondent.

Case reference: 2016044292.CaseDesc: Chenel Dubé was last seen on August 10, 1970 in Montreal, Quebec. That evening, he called his mother to tell her that he would be home later. Chenel's vehicle was found 3 days later in the parking lot of a restaurant in Ville Saint-Laurent, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014003388.CaseDesc: Janet Henry was a resident of Vancouver's downtown east side; she struggled with mental health and was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. Despite her challenges, Ms. Henry kept in frequent contact with her family. She was last seen on June 25, 1997, and was reported missing two days later.

Case reference: 2014005302.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2005, in Toronto, Canada, Zaina Trujillo-Talib was abducted by her father, Chaudhry Talib and her paternal grandmother, Shama Talib.  Chaudhry and Shama immediately took six-year-old Zaina to their family home located in Lahore, Pakistan.  Since this time, Zaina's mother has not been allowed to have any contact with her daughter.

Case reference: 2008245047.CaseDesc: Jadon may be in the company of his non-custodial mother Roxana Eliana YANEZ PARADA.

Case reference: 2008003299.CaseDesc: On May 17, 1985, Cyril Cheong was fishing on White Lake with his friends when the weather deteriorated and strong winds started to blow. Mr. Cheong's boat capsized and his friends were unable to save him.  One of his friends saw him, approximately 2 to 3 feet under the water, beyond his reach.

Case reference: 2018062675.CaseDesc: On November 3, 2018, Aaron Normandeau was seen for the last time by a friend on the Ottawa River in an aluminum boat. The boat capsized and Aaron went under the water and did not resurface.

Case reference: 2014004367.CaseDesc: Kendall Sumner has gone away in the past without notifying anyone, however for him to be away this long is completely out of character.

Case reference: 2013000006.CaseDesc: Joseph Taylor was last seen leaving his residence around midnight on July 30, 2001. He left his residence in a despondent state. It is believed he has started a new life and possibly a new identity for himself in the area around Kelowna in British Columbia. He may be working as a general labourer.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Sword with snake around (5cm)

Case reference: 2014001684.CaseDesc: On June 30th, 1974 Brent Forsyth was 11 years of age when he went missing while fishing along the Bulkley River by Two Mile Creek in Hazelton BC. Brent was last seen upriver fishing a back-eddy. As a result of Brent's disappearance an extensive search involving community members, search and rescue, RCMP Police Dog Services and RCMP air service entailed. Despite these efforts and continued investigations he has never been located. Police have received new information about Brent and are seeking anyone who might have additional information about Brent's disappearance to come forward.

Deformity: Nick on the top right ear

Case reference: 2014007308.CaseDesc: On April 23, 1970, the body of a two to four week old male baby was found on the ice under the bridge on Highway 4, south of Kyle, SK. Investigation failed to identify the infant or suspects. This case is being investigated by the Office of the Chief Coroner and the Royal Canadian Mounted Police.

Case reference: 2014001952.CaseDesc: On September 19, 1980, James Neckoway and a friend left Bird, Manitoba by canoe to go hunting and fishing. They intended to travel down the Limestone River, and then down the Nelson River. The canoe in which the men were travelling and the body of Mr. Neckoway's friend were recovered on September 23. Mr. Neckoway has not been located and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014002340.CaseDesc:
Margaret Schochenmaier was last seen on November 30, 1985, sometime after 3:00pm.  On that day Margaret was in the process of moving from her son's residence; but she never finished the move.
Margaret has previously gone missing in the past, usually for a few days to one month.

Scar: Forehead, Small scar on the left side

Case reference: 2007002399.CaseDesc: Marilyn Neely was last seen by a friend on September 18, 1983, driving Southbound on Goodfellow Road, in the county of Peterborough. Her vehicle, a 1975 Dodge Dart, was later found on the Five Point Trail access road approximately 11 km west of Hwy #507. That same day a woman matching her description was seen walking west along the road from that location.

Purse: Green, White, vinyl with a white shoulder strap

Case reference: 2013000100.CaseDesc: On August 25, 1969, Murdo Baker left his camp to tend to his fish nets. By August 28, he had not returned and Police were notified. Mr. Baker's boat was recovered by police however his remains have never been recovered. It is presumed Mr. Baker drowned.

Scar: Right Leg, Several scars below knee.

Case reference: 2014001219.CaseDesc: On August 25, 1994, the remains of a man were found in Cates Park in North Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had a healed fracture to his right wrist and may have had an old injury to the lower back. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains.  Police are investigating this case as a suspicious death.

Belt: Beige, Khaki, webbed with brass buckle

Case reference: 2021022554.CaseDesc: Muoi Nguyen was last seen on January 5, 1990 and was reported missing on January 12, 1990. Police have not been able to locate Muoi NGUYEN.

Case reference: 2008008099.CaseDesc: Ronald Wallin was canoeing in Upper Manitou Lake located south of Dryden.  Mr. Wallin suffered from what appeared to be a seizure and fell into the water disappering beneath the boat. The area was searched, but Mr. Wallin was not found.

Case reference: 2006021699.CaseDesc: Karl Anderson was last seen on September 3, 1974 in Upsala, Ontario. It was thought that he possibly travelled by train to Sioux Lookout or Thunder Bay to seek medical treatment.

Case reference: 2006023299.CaseDesc: Edward Nelson was last seen on June 21, 1987, in South Bay on Lake Nipigon. He was on a fishing boat heading southwest to go fishing and failed to return.

Case reference: 2005003199.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1990, an unidentified man was found near the Hydro Plant in the Niagara River. He had short fingernails with dirt embedded underneath them and callouses on his hands. His appendix was present and he was uncircumcised.

Hair: Black, Shorter than collar length with dark bushy eyebrows

Scar: Left Index Finger, old scar at the base of the finger
Mark: Left Side Of Neck, small mole

Case reference: 2013000045.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1964, at approximately 11:00 p.m., Noreen Greenly was seen for the last time leaving her friend’s house. Noreen had told her friend that she was going to wait for the bus at the bus stop across the street. The bus driver was interviewed and he stated that he did not pick her up. A witness had reported seeing a young girl get into a small blue car, and sit close to the driver at approximately the same time and location. The car was described as a 1957 to 1959 Ford Perfect which was in good condition.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Blue, A thin necklace with blue pendant
Purse: Dark Blue, dome fastener, change purse with $0.70 inside

Scar: Right Knee, Center of knee cap

Case reference: 2020007647.CaseDesc: On November 17, 1972, at approximately 6:30pm, Horace Brown was last seen by his wife in Toronto, Ontario.

Sweater: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, White, Short sleeves

Case reference: 2016066673.CaseDesc: On May 29, 1982, a disarticulated left foot was found washed up on the shore of Lake Simcoe, in front of the Shore Room Tavern (at the end of the 10th Concession of Innisfil Township). It has been estimated to have been in the water 1-5 years.

Shoes: Brown, Two-tone brown lace-up, size 9D shoe

Case reference: 2006009099.CaseDesc: John Samuel Clifford was last seen on October 10, 1987. He was fishing and hunting near Floods Landing, on Frederickshouse River, in the Township of Blount, District of Cochrane. An extensive search of the area has failed to locate him.

Boots: Rubber, Green, Red, construction safety boots
Coat: Wool, Green, Parka, hydro work jacket

Case reference: 2020048673.CaseDesc: On September 27, 2020, Geoffrey Irwin was last seen on a Royal Bank of Canada surveillance camera in Langford, British Columbia and has not been seen since. On November 25th,2020, Geoffrey Irwin's black 2017 Ford Escape was located at Park Royal Mall in West Vancouver, British Columbia. Geoffrey is known to travel between the West Shore and the Lower Mainland.

Backpack: Nylon, Black, Grey, Black with grey stripes, with zipper
Shorts: Synthetic, Brown, Taupe or light brown colour with pockets, size large
Jacket: Cotton, Grey, Hooded with white drawstrings

Case reference: 2010001999.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Dekleyn was last seen on December 3, 1992, at 1:35 p.m. on a Hamilton RBC bank surveillance camera, making a withdrawal from an ATM machine. Family have not seen or heard from him since and described Mr. Dekleyn as being depressed.

Jacket: Brown, with the Dempsters logo on the left chest

Scar: Torso (Front), Front-to-Back scar on abdomen from surgery to remove kidney.

Case reference: 2014005307.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2006, Kevin Lim, Yee Wah Eva Ho and her boyfriend Jackie Li were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Kevin, Yee Wah Eva and Jackie had been friends with Philip Sit who had been reported missing in 2005. Philip’s remains were found five days prior to Eva, Kevin and Jackie’s disappearance. Philip had been the victim of a homicide.

Hair: Black, Other, Dyed red and styled with spikes

Case reference: 2018023712.CaseDesc: On May 1, 2018, Elsa Vargas was last seen near her home in Chateauguay, Quebec. Ms. Vargas also has citizenship in Costa Rica.

Mark: Right Cheek, Mole on the right side

Case reference: 2014005581.CaseDesc: On March 23, 2011, at approximately 11:00 p.m., Steven Lapowich was last seen at Pearson International Airport in Toronto, Ontario. Steven boarded a flight to Puerto Rico, but never returned home.

Case reference: 2005007099.CaseDesc: On June 27, 1982, an unidentified man was recovered from the Maid of the Mist pool in the Niagara River. His age was estimated to be between 25-50 years old. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 192-195 lbs and his length was measured at 5'9"-5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: His teeth contain both amalgam and composite resin fillings.

Scar: Right Side Of Head, He had previous brain surgery (craniotomy) on the right side of his head.

Case reference: 2014002831.CaseDesc: On December 26, 1980, Zulfiqar Charania was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Zulfiqar lived in Ottawa but was at his sister’s home in Montreal to spend the holidays. When Zulfiqar left Montreal he did so without his suitcase, which was filled with his personal belongings. Zulfiqar had indicated that he intended on travelling to New York in the United States to visit another family member.

Case reference: 2014003136.CaseDesc: Linda Christian Pedersen was last seen at 9:15 a.m. on June 3, 1981 when she left her boyfriend's apartment in Victoria.  She reportedly returned to her own apartment before 11:30 a.m. and spoke to a male acquaintance.  Her whereabouts since that time are unknown.  Linda left behind all valuables and medication.  She was to have met a girlfriend at 4:30 p.m. but failed to show up for the meeting.  She was interested in theatre production and was reportedly meeting an actor during the evening of June 3, 1981.

Hat: Other, Frequently wore a dark-coloured beret

Case reference: 2006015699.CaseDesc: Troy Edgell was last seen on June 4, 2000, in Cornwall, Ontario, driving a maroon 1987, Lincoln. On June 5, 2000, the Lincoln was located, burned out in the Lanark Highlands, northwest of Perth, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004931.CaseDesc: On April 27, 2007, Vimla Patel was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Vimla said she was planning on visiting a family member for the weekend.

Case reference: 2005001099.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2004, an unidentified woman was discovered in a red 2004 Toyota Corolla under the Highway 400 Bridge on Highway 401 in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts this female to be from the Americas, South Asia, or Mixed Americas.

Case reference: 2009003899.CaseDesc: Investigation revealed that Emile Ruger, who resides on Brookdale Ave., had not paid his rent for the month of March and April 2008.  Mr. Ruger usually pays his rent three days in advance to the month due. He was last seen mid-February 2008 and his whereabouts are unknown. Last Seen: Rooming House on Brookdale Avenue

Case reference: 2008002399.CaseDesc: David Manuel Hannah was last seen in Kingston, Ontario, on January 4, 1983. Mr. Hannah was employed as a prison guard at Millhaven Maximum Security Penitentiary in Kingston. His vehicle, a 1969 blue Delta 88, with Ontario licence plate SYM 921 has not been located.

Case reference: 2014001462.CaseDesc: Gareth Austin was last seen on August 17, 1995, and was last known to be in Medicine Hat, Alberta with Dominic Park.

Scar: Left Hand, Scar top of left hand

Case reference: 2014006313.CaseDesc: On Wednesday, November 13, 2013, Carey Cadeau left his residence in Chelmsford. He did not go to work that day, and was reported missing. It is believed he left home on foot. He may still be in the Chelmsford area.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, angel wings with black and grey scripture

Case reference: 2016068993.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1975, the body of a Caucasian female was found floating in the Detroit River near Fighting Island.Her post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 110-150 lbs and her length was measured at 5'4", however, these measurements may not represent her actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. She had pierced ears and her appendix was present. She is believed to have been in the water a few days to a week.

Jewelry: Chain necklace with a tiny bell, a key, and a stone bead pendant.
Shoes: Red, white, and blue laced shoes with a star design on the white stripes
Belt: Silver tie belt made of cloth
Jacket: Cloth, Brown, Waist length jacket, possibly imitation fur

Mark: Abdomen, Abdominal stretch marks suggesting she may have been pregnant at one time

Case reference: 2014003882.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1991, Marcel Paquette was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec when he left in his car to visit his family in the Gaspésie region. His vehicle was located near the city of Causapscal, Quebec. Marcel is diabetic and may have memory problems.

Tattoo: Right Chest, Devil and "Renee et Marie" in text
Left Chest, Heart and "Diane" in text

Case reference: 2014006024.CaseDesc: On March 10, 2013, Richard Bailey was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. He was reported missing by his wife the next day when he failed to return home from work.

Case reference: 2021036756.CaseDesc: On August 6, 2021, Curtis Thorne was seen for the last time when he left his residence in Saint John, New Brunswick. Curtis was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Tattoo: Right Hand, Letters "DIE ALONE" on the knuckles
Left Hand, Letters "DIE ALONE" on the knuckles

Case reference: 2006013199.CaseDesc: Heather Moggy was last seen on June 22, 2002. She may be in the company of John Tucsok who has been affiliated with the "THE ASSEMBLY OF GOD" church. Mr. Tucsok is wanted by the police for offences in Ontario. Heather and John had a joint post office box together in Brantford, Ontario, until September 2003. A letter has been received post marked from Calgary, Alberta. The last contact from Heather Moggy to her family was by telephone, in October 2003, when she indicated that they may be going to Saskatchewan (Moose Jaw).  As of this date, all attempts to locate either subject have failed.

Case reference: 2014003020.CaseDesc: On October 7, 1997, Judy Desjarlais and a friend were sitting outside of their shared residence on Cameron Ave, Edmonton, overlooking the North Saskatchewan River. Judy took off running down towards the river. Her friend heard Judy in the river calling for help and went into the water looking for her.

Scar: Chin, Noticeable scar on left chin
Mark: Chin, Mole on left side of chin
Waist, 2 moles, 1 on each side of the stomach

Case reference: 2018067156.CaseDesc: On November 27, 2018, Courtney James was seen for the last time on security camera footage in Niagara Falls, Ontario.
